prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Description Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5357, 0.0]. Create Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Face 1 * Loop 1: 1. Draw a line from coordinates [0.0, 0.0] to [0.4643, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from coordinates [0.4643, 0.0] to [0.4643, 0.75]. 3. Draw a line from coordinates [0.4643, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75]. 4. Draw a line from coordinates [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0]. * Loop 2: 1. Draw a line from coordinates [0.0357, 0.0357] to [0.4286, 0.0357]. 2. Draw a line from coordinates [0.4286, 0.0357] to [0.4286, 0.7143]. 3. Draw a line from coordinates [0.4286, 0.7143] to [0.0357, 0.7143]. 4. Draw a line from coordinates [0.0357, 0.7143] to [0.0357, 0.0357]. Create 3D Model Extrude the sketched shapes along the Z-axis by 0.5357 units. Scale Model Apply a uniform scale to the model with a scaling factor of 0.75. Finalize Model Complete the model with a "New Body Feature Operation". The dimensions of the final part are length: 0.75, width: 0.5357, and height: 0.3767.</description>

Extrude to a depth of 0.75 units towards the normal of the sketch plane, and 0.0 units in the opposite direction.**
</description>
